Name: Question 1
Description: Try it for yourself! Do a take 10 on all the other tables to see what kind of data they contain. (Type ‘done’ when you are finished!)

Name: Question 2
Description: How many employees are in the company?

Name: Question 3
Description: Each employee at The Krusty Krab is assigned an IP address. Which employee has the IP address: “192.168.2.184”? (What is their name?)

Name: Question 4
Description: How many emails did Roy Warren receive?

Name: Question 5
Description: How many users received emails with the term “custard” in the subject?

Name: Question 6
Description: How many unique websites did “Marcos Cohen” visit?

Name: Question 7
Description: How many domains in the PassiveDNS records contain the word “jellyfish”? (Hint: use the contains operator instead of has. If you get stuck do a take 10 on the table to see what fields are available.)

Name: Question 8
Description: How many IPs has the domain “genius.pizza” resolved to?

Name: Question 9
Description: How many unique URLs were browsed by employees named “Michelle?”

Name: Question 1
Description: How many users in our organization were sent emails containing the domain chum.net?

Name: Question 2
Description: One of the employees who was targeted has a 'y' in their name. Who is this employee?

Name: Question 3
Description: How many of the emails containing chum.net were blocked? (hint: the “accepted” field in the Email table tells you whether or not the email was blocked. Blocked emails will show as false).

Name: Question 4
Description: How many unique IP addresses does chum.org resolve to?

Name: Question 5
Description: How many unique IP addresses does fun.com resolve to?

Name: Question 6
Description: How many unique IP addresses does genius.org resolve to?

Name: Question 7
Description: How many unique domains does IP 43.243.201.76 host?

Name: Question 8
Description: How many unique domains does IP 101.143.139.17 host?

Name: Question 9
Description: How many “.net” domains resolve to IP 192.224.255.208? (hint: you can use the in operator to check for multiple values in a field. E.g. | where field in (“x” “y” “z”)

Name: Question 10
Description: How many ".com" domains resolve to IP 43.243.201.76?

Name: Question 11
Description: Which ".pizza" domain resolved to the same IP as fun.com

Name: Question 12
Description: Which ".net" domain resolved to the same IP as chum-fun.food

Name: Question 13
Description: How many email addresses did the hackers use to send these domains (the .net domains you found in question #23)?

Name: Question 14
Description: How many of these emails had mismatched sender and reply-to addresses? (You can use the != operators to check if two things are not the same)

Name: Question 15
Description: How many users clicked on a link containing the domain "fun.com"?

Name: Question 16
Description: What was the timestamp of the first employee that clicked on a phishing link containing the domain "fun.com"?

Name: Question 17
Description: What was the first domain sent by "krabbs@yandex.com"? (Hint: You can click on the event_time column header to sort the rows by time. Then find the link for the email that was sent first.)

Name: Question 18
Description: What was the first email address used to send an email containing a link to "picket.pizza"?

Name: Question 19
Description: Which email address was used to send a link to "bucketdomination.com"?

Name: Question 20
Description: Based on the data you've seen (email addresses domains and subject lines) which SpongeBob character do you believe is responsible for the malicious activity targeting the Krusty Krab?

Name: Question 1
Description: How many lab technicians work at EnvolveLabs?

Name: Question 2
Description: What is Ken Hawkins' hostname?

Name: Question 3
Description: A user received an email with the subject "ALERT: Your password has expired and needs to be reset". Who was the email sent by?

Name: Question 4
Description: How many unique domains were sent by the sender alert_helpdesk@protonmail.com?

Name: Question 5
Description: How many users clicked on links sent by alert_helpdesk@protonmail.com?

Name: Question 6
Description: When did "Deirdre Greenwood" click on the link sent by "alert_helpdesk@protonmail.com"? (Hint: Copy and paste the exact timestamp you see in ADX)

Name: Question 7
Description: What is Deirdre Greenwood's username?

Name: Question 8
Description: What adversary (bad actor) IP was used to login to Deirdre Greenwood's account?

Name: Question 9
Description: Did the actor manage to steal (exfiltrate) the contents of Deirdre’s account (via the same IP)?

Name: Question 10
Description: How many unique email accounts did the IP above log into? (the IP identified in question 8)

Name: Question 11
Description: The actors (via the same IP identified in question 8) tried to steal the email contents of this many users.

Name: Question 12
Description: How many email addresses sent emails with the same subject as "alert_helpdesk@protonmail.com"?

Name: Question 13
Description: How many unique links were sent by the senders above?

Name: Question 14
Description: On March 2nd 2022 Troy Gibbons observed a suspicious login to his account. What was the subject of the email that led to this compromise?

Name: Question 15
Description: The subject above (from question 14) was sent by this many unique email senders.

Name: Question 16
Description: Of the emails with this subject how many of them had spoofed senders?

Name: Question 17
Description: How many emails sent by "pandemic@qq.com" have links to file downloads?

Name: Question 18
Description: The domains “flashback.info” and “securityaccredits.site” are linked together by one common indicator of compromise (IOC). What is that common IOC? (Hint: IOCs can be email addresses IP addresses domain or subject)

Name: Question 19
Description: Juan Carrington was targeted with an email from cdc@hotmail.com. How many minutes elapsed between when he was sent the phishing email and when he clicked the link? (Hint: Round down to the nearest whole number of minutes)

Name: Question 20
Description: One employee had their account compromised by the attackers at 2022-01-04 09:47:57.770149. Who was this employee (their name)?

Name: Question 1
Description: What day of the week is it?

Name: Question 2
Description: What is 1+1?

Name: Question 3
Description: What is the name of this game?

Name: Question 4
Description: What is the name of Iranian threat actor associated with the file hash 03d0e7ad4c12273a42e4c95d854408b98b0cf5ecf5f8c5ce05b24729b6f4e369? (Hint Its a cat)

Name: Question 5
Description: This individual nicknamed “Hutch” was one of the co-authors of the Lockheed Martin Cyber Kill Chain white paper

Name: Question 6
Description: Microsoft assesses that this technology company is front company for Iranian advanced persistent threat group DEV-0270/PHOSPHORUS

Name: Question 7
Description: A North Korea-based threat actor group nearly made off with $1B in a cryptocurrency heist in mid-2021. What is the name of this actor group?

Name: Question 8
Description: The 2014 hack of Sony Pictures Entertainment was conducted to discourage the release this movie that satirizes North Korean leader Kim Jong Un

Name: Question 9
Description: What is the second phase of the Cyber Kill Chain

Name: Question 10
Description: What university did Greg Attend?
